channel.title: [C#]Silent Mouse
channel.description:
So I have my window. Let's call it Wnd. Basically, I've been looking around for a long time for a function that can send mouse events (specifically clicking at a location) to a window. What I mean by silent, is that the window wouldn't have to have the focus to recieve the click.
I'm basically asking if anyone knows of anyway (any information would be appreciated) to send mouse clicks to a non-focused window.
Thanks in advance
-David

item.title: [C#]Silent Mouse
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Well, you know what a service is do you? Ofcourse it could be done with just a general app, but would be harder to make. A service is a background task that checks every x miliseconds if y is performed. So if you know how to capture the mouse, run a loop if so, else run it again.

Read full topic

item.title: [C#]Silent Mouse
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

I’m not really a noob, but I’m not too sure as to what you mean by “Run as a service”. I’m using an interface I’ve already built, and so ideally I’m looking for a function that’d just be something like SilentMouse(x,y);. Obviously the coding for this function is what I’m after, or just a general guideline on how to achieve it.

Thanks very much for your fast response, but would you care to elaborate a bit more?

Read full topic

item.title: [C#]Silent Mouse
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Run as a service

Read full topic
